text: Keshav Chandra Duttother sources spell his name Datt also spelt as Keshav Datt (29 December 1925 â€“ 7 July 2021) was an Indian field hockey player and played as a halfback. He was a part of the team that won gold medals at the 1948 and 1952 Olympics. He made 22 international appearances for India and scored two goals in his career. Dutt died on 7 July 2021 at the age of 95 in Kolkata. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Indian field hockey players Category:Olympic gold medalists for India
title: Keshav Dutt
